summary.long: Ephesians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God,
To the saints who are in Ephesus and are faithful in Christ Jesus:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us in Christ with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as he chose us in Christ before the foundation of the world to be holy and blameless before him in love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He destined us for adoption as his children through Jesus Christ, according to the good pleasure of his will,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the praise of his glorious grace that he freely bestowed on us in the Beloved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In him we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of our trespasses, according to the riches of his grace
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that he lavished on us. With all wisdom and insight
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he has made known to us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure that he set forth in Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as a plan for the fullness of time, to gather up all things in him, things in heaven and things on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Christ we have also obtained an inheritance, having been destined according to the purpose of him who accomplishes all things according to his counsel and will,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that we, who were the first to set our hope on Christ, might live for the praise of his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In him you also, when you had heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation, and had believed in him, were marked with the seal of the promised Holy Spirit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this is the pledge of our inheritance toward redemption as God’s own people, to the praise of his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love toward all the saints, and for this reason
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not cease to give thanks for you as I remember you in my prayers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give you a spirit of wisdom and revelation as you come to know him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that, with the eyes of your heart enlightened, you may perceive what is the hope to which he has called you, what are the riches of his glorious inheritance among the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and what is the immeasurable greatness of his power for us who believe, according to the working of his great power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God put this power to work in Christ when he raised him from the dead and seated him at his right hand in the heavenly places,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: far above all rule and authority and power and dominion and above every name that is named, not only in this age but also in the age to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he has put all things under his feet and has made him the head over all things for the church,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which is his body, the fullness of him who fills all in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You were dead through the trespasses and sins
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which you once walked, following the course of this world, following the ruler of the power of the air, the spirit that is now at work among those who are disobedient.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of us once lived among them in the passions of our flesh, doing the will of flesh and senses, and we were by nature children of wrath, like everyone else,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but God, who is rich in mercy, out of the great love with which he loved us
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even when we were dead through our trespasses, made us alive together with Christ—by grace you have been saved—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and raised us up with him and seated us with him in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that in the ages to come he might show the immeasurable riches of his grace in kindness toward us in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by grace you have been saved through faith, and this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not the result of works, so that no one may boast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are what he has made us, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand so that we may walk in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, remember that at one time you gentiles by birth, called “the uncircumcision” by those who are called “the circumcision”—a circumcision made in the flesh by human hands—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: remember that you were at that time without Christ, being aliens from the commonwealth of Israel and strangers to the covenants of promise, having no hope and without God in the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now in Christ Jesus you who once were far off have been brought near by the blood of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he is our peace; in his flesh he has made both into one and has broken down the dividing wall, that is, the hostility between us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: abolishing the law with its commandments and ordinances, that he might create in himself one new humanity in place of the two, thus making peace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and might reconcile both to God in one body through the cross, thus putting to death that hostility through it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he came and proclaimed peace to you who were far off and peace to those who were near,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for through him both of us have access in one Spirit to the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, you are no longer strangers and aliens, but you are fellow citizens with the saints and also members of the household of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, with Christ Jesus himself as the cornerstone;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in him the whole structure is joined together and grows into a holy temple in the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom you also are built together spiritually into a dwelling place for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the reason that I, Paul, am a prisoner for Christ Jesus for the sake of you gentiles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for surely you have already heard of the commission of God’s grace that was given me for you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and how the mystery was made known to me by revelation, as I wrote above in a few words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a reading of which will enable you to perceive my understanding of the mystery of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In former generations this mystery was not made known to humankind, as it has now been revealed to his holy apostles and prophets by the Spirit:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that is, the gentiles have become fellow heirs, members of the same body, and sharers in the promise in Christ Jesus through the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of this gospel I have become a servant according to the gift of God’s grace that was given me by the working of his power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although I am the very least of all the saints, this grace was given to me to bring to the gentiles the news of the boundless riches of Christ
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to make everyone see what is the plan of the mystery hidden for ages in God, who created all things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that through the church the wisdom of God in its rich variety might now be made known to the rulers and authorities in the heavenly places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was in accordance with the eternal purpose that he has carried out in Christ Jesus our Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom we have access in boldness and confidence through faith in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pray, therefore, that you may not lose heart over my sufferings for you; they are your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I bow my knees before the Father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from whom every family in heaven and on earth takes its name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pray that, according to the riches of his glory, he may grant that you may be strengthened in your inner being with power through his Spirit
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith, as you are being rooted and grounded in love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pray that you may have the power to comprehend, with all the saints, what is the breadth and length and height and depth
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to know the love of Christ that surpasses knowledge, so that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now to him who by the power at work within us is able to accomplish abundantly far more than all we can ask or imagine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to him be glory in the church and in Christ Jesus to all generations, forever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, therefore, the prisoner in the Lord, beg you to walk in a manner worthy of the calling to which you have been called,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with all humility and gentleness, with patience, bearing with one another in love,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: making every effort to maintain the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: there is one body and one Spirit, just as you were called to the one hope of your calling,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one Lord, one faith, one baptism,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one God and Father of all, who is above all and through all and in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But each of us was given grace according to the measure of Christ’s gift.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: (When it says, “He ascended,” what does it mean but that he had also descended into the lower parts of the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who descended is the same one who ascended far above all the heavens, so that he might fill all things.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He himself granted that some are apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors and teachers
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to equip the saints for the work of ministry, for building up the body of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until all of us come to the unity of the faith and of the knowledge of the Son of God, to maturity, to the measure of the full stature of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We must no longer be children, tossed to and fro and blown about by every wind of doctrine by people’s trickery, by their craftiness in deceitful scheming;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but speaking the truth in love, we must grow up in every way into him who is the head, into Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from whom the whole body, joined and knit together by every ligament with which it is equipped, as each part is working properly, promotes the body’s growth in building itself up in love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this I affirm and insist on in the Lord: you must no longer walk as the gentiles walk, in the futility of their minds;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they are darkened in their understanding, alienated from the life of God because of their ignorance and hardness of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have lost all sensitivity and have abandoned themselves to licentiousness, greedy to practice every kind of impurity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is not the way you learned Christ!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For surely you have heard about him and were taught in him, as truth is in Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to put away your former way of life, your old self, corrupt and deluded by its lusts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to be renewed in the spirit of your minds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to clothe yourselves with the new self, created according to the likeness of God in true righteousness and holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, putting away falsehood, let each of you speak the truth with your neighbor, for we are members of one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be angry but do not sin; do not let the sun go down on your anger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and do not make room for the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who steal must give up stealing; rather, let them labor, doing good work with their own hands, so as to have something to share with the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no evil talk come out of your mouths but only what is good for building up, as there is need, so that your words may give grace to those who hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, with which you were marked with a seal for the day of redemption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put away from you all bitterness and wrath and anger and wrangling and slander, together with all malice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ has forgiven you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore be imitators of God, as beloved children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and walk in love, as Christ loved us and gave himself up for us, a fragrant offering and sacrifice to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But sexual immorality and impurity of any kind or greed must not even be mentioned among you, as is proper among saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Entirely out of place is obscene, silly, and vulgar talk; but instead, let there be thanksgiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be sure of this, that no sexually immoral or impure person or one who is greedy (that is, an idolater) has any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one deceive you with empty words, for because of these things the wrath of God comes on those who are disobedient.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore do not be associated with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for once you were darkness, but now in the Lord you are light. Walk as children of light,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the fruit of the light is found in all that is good and right and true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Try to find out what is pleasing to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take no part in the unfruitful works of darkness; rather, expose them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is shameful even to mention what such people do secretly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but everything exposed by the light becomes visible,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for everything that becomes visible is light. Therefore it says,
“Sleeper, awake!
    Rise from the dead,
and Christ will shine on you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful, then, how you live, not as unwise people but as wise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: making the most of the time, because the days are evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do not be foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not get drunk with wine, for that is debauchery, but be filled with the Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as you sing psalms and hymns and spiritual songs to one another, singing and making melody to the Lord in your hearts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: giving thanks to God the Father at all times and for everything in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: being subject to one another out of reverence for Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wives, be subject to your husbands as to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the husband is the head of the wife just as Christ is the head of the church, his body, and is himself its Savior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as the church is subject to Christ, so also wives ought to be, in everything, to their husbands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order to make her holy by cleansing her with the washing of water by the word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so as to present the church to himself in splendor, without a spot or wrinkle or anything of the kind, so that she may be holy and without blemish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, husbands should love their wives as their own bodies. He who loves his wife loves himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no one ever hates his own flesh, but he nourishes and tenderly cares for it, just as Christ does for the church,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because we are members of his body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife, and the two will become one flesh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is a great mystery, but I am speaking about Christ and the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of you, however, should love his wife as himself, and a wife should respect her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for this is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Honor your father and mother”—this is the first commandment with a promise—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “so that it may be well with you and you may live long on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but bring them up in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Slaves, obey your earthly masters with respect and trembling, in singleness of heart, as you obey Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not with a slavery performed merely for looks, to please people, but as slaves of Christ, doing the will of God from the soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Render service with enthusiasm, as for the Lord and not for humans,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that whatever good we do, we will receive the same again from the Lord, whether we are enslaved or free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, masters, do the same to them. Stop threatening them, for you know that both of you have the same Lord in heaven, and with him there is no partiality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, be strong in the Lord and in the strength of his power;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: put on the whole armor of God, so that you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for our struggle is not against blood and flesh but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the cosmic powers of this present darkness, against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore take up the whole armor of God, so that you may be able to withstand on the evil day and, having prevailed against everything, to stand firm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stand, therefore, and belt your waist with truth and put on the breastplate of righteousness
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lace up your sandals in preparation for the gospel of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With all of these, take the shield of faith, with which you will be able to quench all the flaming arrows of the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray in the Spirit at all times in every prayer and supplication. To that end, keep alert and always persevere in supplication for all the saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray also for me, so that when I speak a message may be given to me to make known with boldness the mystery of the gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for which I am an ambassador in chains. Pray that I may declare it boldly, as I must speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that you also may know how I am and what I am doing, Tychicus will tell you everything. He is a dear brother and a faithful minister in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am sending him to you for this very purpose, to let you know how we are and to encourage your hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peace be to the brothers and sisters and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace be with all who have an undying love for our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator
